p: As a result of this inaction at the global level, the EU moved to include maritime emissions in the EU ETS from 2023. The EU scheme aims to include all CO2 emissions from ships sailing between or berthed at EU ports, and 50% of CO2 emissions between EU and non-EU ports. The amount of these emissions needing to be covered by ETS permits will be phased in gradually up to 100% by 2026 (Psaraftis, 2021).
